page.title: 18The Airedale Family Centre
page.content: The centre has been open for 8 years and has a range of activities for all ages from under-55's to O.A.P's.It has 3 youth clubs for children from 7 to 14+ years and a pre-school group.The centre has wet and dry areas for creative work ,a printing workshop,a reading room and a dancing or games area.People may sit and chat in the coffee bar too.During the 1984 coal strike logs were stolen from the adventure playground for use as fuel and there is no money for repairs.The centre has an advice service to help famlies with difficulies and the rise in unemployment and the miners strike caused extra work.Groups of unemployed people meet to discuss their problems,one-parent families and O.A.Ps come in,and mentally and physically handicapped people make friends at the centre.
